intro: Hypericum anagalloides var. nevadense, commonly known as the Nevada St. John's Wort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features yellow flowers with five petals, and its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. It is part of the genus Hypericum, which includes many species with medicinal and ornamental value. This variety is particularly adapted to high-elevation habitats and is considered a rare and endemic species.
